titleStmt.title: Epulario, or The Italian banquet wherein is shewed the maner how to dresse and prepare all kind of flesh, foules or fishes. As also how to make sauces, tartes, pies, &c. After the maner of all countries. With an addition of many other profitable and necessary things. Translated out of Italian into English.
Epulario. English
titleStmt.author: Rosselli, Giovanne de.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A[dam] I[slip] for William Barley, and are to bee sold at his shop in Gratious street, neere Leaden-hall,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Opera nova chiamata Epulario.
Running title reads: The Italian banquet.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: his shop in Gratious street, neere Leaden-hall
